meanings.definition: The act of making something later.
meanings.sent1: Her constant laterizations of tasks caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent2: I had to do a laterization of my dentist appointment due to a scheduling conflict.
meanings.sent3: The laterizations of bedtime by the children led to a chaotic evening routine.
meanings.sent4: His laterizations of decisions turned the simple task into a complex problem.
meanings.sent5: The laterizations of the meeting time made it hard for everyone to attend.

meanings.definition: The process of delaying or postponing something.
meanings.sent1: The laterizations of the event announcement frustrated many attendees.
meanings.sent2: We experienced a laterization of the flight due to bad weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The laterizations of the surprise party made it even more exciting for the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: The laterizations of the project submission deadline added unnecessary stress.
meanings.sent5: His constant laterizations of decisions made him seem indecisive.

meanings.definition: The act of moving something to a later time or date.
meanings.sent1: The laterizations of the meeting conflicted with other appointments.
meanings.sent2: She requested a laterization of the delivery date for convenience.
meanings.sent3: The laterizations of the movie night made it difficult to plan with friends.
meanings.sent4: His laterizations of the event caused confusion among the participants.
meanings.sent5: The laterizations of the deadline gave us more time to prepare.
